sn7.7:1.2: Then the brahmin Suddhika Bhāradvāja approached the Blessed One  and exchanged greetings with him.
sn7.7:1.3: When they had concluded their greetings and cordial talk,
sn7.7:1.4: he sat down to one side  and recited this verse in the presence of the Blessed One:
sn7.7:2.1: “In the world no brahmin is ever purified
sn7.7:2.2: Though he be virtuous and austere in practice;
sn7.7:2.3: One accomplished in knowledge and conduct is purified,
sn7.7:2.4: Not the others, the common folk. ”
sn7.7:3.1: [The Blessed One: ]  “Even though one mutters many chants,
sn7.7:3.2: One does not become a brahmin by birth
sn7.7:3.3: If one is rotten within and defiled,
sn7.7:4.3: If one is energetic and resolute,
sn7.7:4.6: Know, O brahmin, that this is so. ”
sn7.7:5.1: When this was said, the brahmin Suddhika Bhāradvāja said to the Blessed One:
sn7.7:5.3: And the Venerable Bhāradvāja became one of the arahants.
